channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2024120071
item.description:
Report E-2024120071

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-04
  • City: JANESVILLE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 4, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint were punctured in transit and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all waste into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024120072
item.description:
Report E-2024120072

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-09T12:25:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-03
  • City: JANESVILLE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 3, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of paint was damaged by a forklift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect and containerize all waste in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024120335
item.description:
Report X-2024120335

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS LEAKED ON BY ANOTHER PACKAGE. ONCE HANDLED IT SOUNDED LIKE AEROSOL CANS. ONCE OPENED IT WAS CONFIRMED TO BE AEROSOL CANS WITH INNER BOXES HAVING A LIMITED QUANTITY STICKER. THE OUTER PACKAGING WAS USED, AND HAD NO APPLICABLE MARKINGS.

item.title: Report X-2024120243
item.description:
Report X-2024120243

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-19
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO PICK UP A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE PURPLE BELT. RESPONDER PLACED PACKAGE IN A LINED SPILL TRAY, CLEANED UP THE SPILL RESIDUE AND BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE SERVICE CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
